item.title: TLUG Technical Meeting - December 2025
item.description:
• ğŸ—“ é–‹å§‹: 2025å¹´12æœˆ6æ—¥(åœŸ) 13:00
  • ğŸ• çµ‚äº†: 2025å¹´12æœˆ6æ—¥(åœŸ) 16:00
  • ğŸ“ ä¼šå ´: Axsh / Japanese Wine SoirÃ©e
  • ğŸ¢ ä½æ‰€: ã€’151-0051 Tokyo, Shibuya, Sendagaya, 3 Chomeâˆ’24âˆ’8 åŒ—å‚é“ï¼² 1F
  • ğŸ·ï¸ ãƒãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ã‚¿ã‚°: #tlug

Call for Presenters:

We are currently recruiting presenters. The meeting is not open to register yet. Please contact brian@tiuxo.com if you would like to present.

Topics:

Any technology / computer / *nix / maker related topic is OK! Of course, Linux-related presentations will be prioritized.

Formats:

Any format, including short "lightning" talks are OK! Please indicate how much time you would like. If it cannot fit in this meeting, it will be prioritized for the next technical meeting.

Language:

TLUG presentations are in English, but please don't feel intimidated! You do not have to be a native-level English speaker to present at TLUG.

Resources:

This meeting location has a presentation screen using HDMI and available power outlets. Please indicate if there are other resource you require for your presentation.

Thanks

This meeting's venue is provided by Axsh: Lighting the Future of Networks with SDN Technology https://axsh.jp

Links

  • TLUG: https://tlug.jp
  • Venue: https://soiree-wine.com
  • Apple Maps: https://maps.apple.com/place?place-id=IC6CC040218BCC856
  • Google Maps: https://maps.app.goo.gl/x7GUcvs2JWYnf8TK7

èª¿æ•´ä¸­

ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯7 batch interface for all numerical code

Batch interface enables higher-level software architecture with array, the key data structure for high-performance computing (HPC). The regular memory layout allows fast code. Making high-level API requires expandable collectors in addition to fixed-sized arrays. We use a simple scalable vector graphic (SVG) parser to show how to design with the batch interface iteratively.
